holidays.name: Silly Putty Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the quirky, bouncy, and endlessly entertaining silicone compound known as Silly Putty! Stretch it, bounce it, or use it to lift comic strips off the newspaper.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the day in 1943 when Silly Putty was accidentally invented by James Wright, a GE scientist attempting to create a synthetic rubber substitute during World War II.
holidays.funFact: Silly Putty once made headlines when astronauts carried it into space as a stress reliever and creative tool.

holidays.name: Paper Airplane Day
holidays.description: Time to fold, glide, and soar with all kinds of paper airplanes! Celebrate this crafty toy that has fascinated kids and adults for generations.
holidays.origin: An unofficial holiday embraced by paper plane enthusiasts to honor this simple yet scientific paper craft and the joy it brings.
holidays.funFact: The longest recorded flight of a paper airplane is 69.14 meters (226 feet, 10 inches) set in 2012!
